caption: A nice and big garden. I visited this garden during the fall and the colors of the trees were very pretty in √† vibrant orange and yellowish color. It‚Äôs also a very good place for children to play and people to relax. I recommend it if you like nature and/or walk around beautiful scenic areas.

A nice botanical / ornamental garden with several lakes, a kids playground, and many wonderful picnic spots.  I particularly liked how they made a number of bee hives and bird houses into works of art.  The "purple" flower section was spectacular while we were there (early July).

Truly the most spectacular place on the edge of Paris, blooming from late February to November - seas of daffodils, cascades of Hortensia, clouds of azalea, magnificent camellia trees, and much more. The best time to visit is April and May, as featured on my photos. It's a secret place not known to tourists, offering simply enormous space integrated with nature, including ponds and sculptures. There are a few places to eat, a selection of bonsai trees in the pavilion, and peacocks roaming outdoors. Plenty of cute spots for a romantic picnic can be found throughout. There's a large playground space for kids on the further edge of the park, and in autumn, a section of large flower beds features hundreds of dahlia blooms. Easy access by metro, with a 2.5 eur ticket and free entrance off-season.

Lovely place with impressive thematic areas, like big bonsai exposition, art exposition, special gardens for different family of flowers/plants, and even some birds, ducks and peacocks around. Very relaxing, well organized and beautiful place to visit and spend some time for photos, contemplation and learning about different plants/flowers.
Beautifully done. Dress warm and you'll have lots of fun

When you enter the park you won't feel that there's so much more inside. A big park with lots of flowering and non flowering plants and trees. You can easily spend half a day to full day here. Different kinds of flowers, shrubs, creepers, trees etc. which are a treat for nature lovers. Even though we visited in spring about 75% have bloomed the rest are yet to make a peek.  There are couple of restaurants and toilet facility inside the park. There are lots of benches everywhere inside the park which is a boon. The entrance fee is just 3.5 euros which you can take online through app or buy from the counter. Easily accessible by bus number 112 and 207 or by metro 1 (chateau de vincennes) There's some work goin on in the chateau else that's also a good option to visit. All in all you will definitely enjoy the park.
I love love love this place!  I try to go monthly throughout the summer because the plants and flowers are always changing. It‚Äôs a wonderful place to walk around and so cheap to enter.
Amazing park with a lot of playgrounds and bicycles for rent. Looks more like a forest than a French garden.

Amazing park!!! The variety of plants and flowers it‚Äôs unbelievable‚Ä¶ And I must say that the playground for kids its the most amazing I have ever seen. Besides of the many normal playgrounds there are two scape rooms, zip lines and bikes to rent. My daughter was amazed and me too!!! Highly recommended to spend an easy and fun day surrounded by trees and flowers üíï

A huge park with a huge biodiversity. I visited in December, and i loved the Fall look. I have heard this place looks amazing in summers and spring, will have to see it myself though. Its a great place to bring your kids, they will definitely love it.

Lovely walking trails, spacious picnic areas, not to mention the muliple playgrounds that are not just for young kids but to teenagers as well.  It's a beautiful and massive garden/ park for both adult and kids to enjoy.

Such a lovely and wide parc. Amazing views with different type of birds. Alot of activities for kids and adults and places to have a picnic. Paid entry (discount for young people and students), however they're not taking care of their facilities properly.

Very terrible and rude attitude against children!  We have visited this place with our 3 weeks old baby, on the main door writing that the place close at 20:00, at 19:30 comes a very rude man to us and started to scream by French to us direct people out side the place, I have asked the man if he speaks English.  He said in a very loud and rude attitude ‚Äúyou just go outside the place, time is over‚Äù  I have asked the man nicely if he give us 5 minutes to feed our baby as he was crying in this moment.  The man ignored what I say and keep screaming to us, go out now or I call the police!  The man did followed us to the man entrance and keeps shouting by French until we meet another employee at the entrance, I have asked her if she can stop the man shouting to us and allow my wife to feed the baby as the time was not 20:00 already, she ignored the conversation and made her self doesn‚Äôt understand English.  We left the place with terrible memories and of course will never come back or recommend to visit this place ( it‚Äôs very rude and aggressive staff working there without any management responsibility for the tourists )

We went on the first Sat of November and got in for free. We were pleasantly surprised to see tons of dahlias still blooming. They have a large bonsai collection, and a room with succulents, and a room showing the evolution of plants. There are tons of beautiful, landscaped trails. Bathrooms, fountains for filling a water bottle, and lots of picnic tables. Sadly, they do not allow dogs.

I went in winter which I believe was not a good idea as I did not see a single living flower haha. I felt its more kids play parc but in the reviews and photos people posted flowers which haven't seen any in January. Overall was a good walk for me.

A lovely botanical park with extensive grounds on the outskirts of Paris, adjacent to the old Chateau de Vincennes.  Well maintained flower gardens, with a pond and pleasant walking paths through the grounds. The park has a variety of trees, evergreens, and flowering shrubs from around the world, with several buildings housing tropical plants, succulents & cacti, and butterflies. A wonderful place for plant lovers and those seeking a tranquil afternoon away from the city.

It‚Äôs an awesome park with lots of quirky installations! Its great to bring kids here as there are open areas, seats to rest at, good paths to push your strollers. There are also plenty of wildlife here! It‚Äôs 2.5 euros from May to sept and free from Oct to April. It was still lovely to visit in October when the weather was still warm enough. Th√© bonsa√Ø exhibition inside this park was also a bonus that was amazing to see. Be sure to check it out.

It‚Äôs ok‚Ä¶ these reviews raving about it make me think the population needs to travel to a lot more parks. Singapore‚Äôs FREE botanical gardens blows this meagre park away. That said it‚Äôs nice enough for a stroll, it‚Äôs clean and the bench by the pond is a peaceful spot to watch the geese and ducks meandering. Plus if there is classical music playing in the nearby amphitheatre you can overhear it, making for a relaxing experience. Lots of families.

Huge parc/ jardin kinda a botanical flower garden. Located in one complex area with Bois de Vincennes and just in front of Chateau de Vincennes. You‚Äôll be amazed and be happy to see the human interest in flowers here.

A beautiful botanical garden in Vincennes. Accessible by metro line 1, ‚Ç¨2.50 entry (‚Ç¨1.50 reduced) and worth it. There are peacocks and lots of geese, flower gardens, beautiful trees, a play park for kids with a big slide, greenhouses with exotic plants and bonsai. Definitely worth a trip. A haven of nature.

Beautiful and blooming park with water fountains and lots of places to pick nick. Some eareas are forestry with lots of shadows.  Also we found a nice garden with vegetables and scarecrow. Where is a publick toilet and a place to buy ice-cream and drinks. A good place to rest from the city noise. We even saw a peacock. Good for  families with kids

I did NOT expect to see such beauty near Paris!! The Parc Floral has such a diversity of plants and flowers it‚Äôs insane. So so pretty and idea for a picnic. It is big enough for everyone to find a nice spot, not too crowded. I would highly suggest people to go visit various houses of plants (Bonsa√Øs, Dalhia‚Ä¶ even butterflies house!) Amazing!!

After 20 years, finally visited this place and I see it's 19 years too late.  Admission price of a few euro, kids playground from heaven in the rear of the park.  Beautiful rosary, pretty insane bonsai collection, equally impressive fern Park, lunch rooms, plenty toilets.   My advice: take your kids, bring your lunch, picnic on one of the fields and forget about time.
Such a wonderful day out! Beautifully taken care of, amazing views, fresh air, and calming quiet
Really nice place to spend relaxing time.

One of the most beautiful parks in the city. Very spacious, with lakes, fountains, large trees, a great variety of flowers, and lots of grass areas for picnics. The entry is paid but very cheap. There are free cultural events during summer.

Really fun mini golf course. All 18 holes are small versions of the monuments of Paris. The course is well maintained and the staff was very friendly. It costs 12 ‚Ç¨ per adult and you can also buy drinks and sweets at the kiosk. It took a couple of hours to go through the whole course with 4 people. I would highly recommend this activity for a fun family day.

It‚Äôs located in the Bois de Vincennes, and the entrance is 2.5‚Ç¨ which is reasonable. There are several playgrounds and educational places for kids, ideal for the family visit. And don‚Äôt miss the peacock.

If you want an inexpensive but beautiful park experience then this is the park for you.  Take a lazy stroll around Parc Floral de Paris for 2.50 euros.  The Dalias will entrance your park experience.  This is the Dalia festival.  You can vote for the top three Dalias.
Take time to relax and walk through a tranquil park, grab a bite to eat and take it all in.

Came in late autumn so I didn't expect too much but the scenes are out of my expectation. The park showed my how beautiful the colour of autumn can be. I enjoyed the walk in the park quietly without many tourists.

Beautiful natural place, you can used to go, metro 1 . There have lots of flowers garden, Bonsai tree, bamboo garden,  water lily, entry tickets  under 25 years people  1.5 euro, over 25 years 2.5 euro.

It is a nice place for group picnic and kids for playground. It has many different kind of tree and flowers and garden in Chine or Japanese style botanic. Better to relaxing and enjoy the meal there during the summer in Paris.

Love this park! The full ticket is 2.5‚Ç¨ and the student ticket is 1.5‚Ç¨.  Right now in April it‚Äôs full of flowers, Sakura, tulip, camellia and so on. Such a romantic place for picnic.  Also you can find plenty of birds, goose and peacocks! They are not afraid of human and the geese are so funny and aggressive. Peacocks like to shower off in front of people!  The park is not far from Paris but not full at all! Definitely deserve to pay and enter!

Beautiful parc suitable for all ages 0-99! Well kept and very clean. Fantastic playground for children with the longest slides there could possibly be. It‚Äôs perfect for a picnic. Very affordable and a great day out with the entire family!

A relatively small parc. It is very beautiful during certain periods of time but not all over the year. There is a toilet inside. The entrance fee is 2-3 eur between the beginning of April and the end of September. It is not very easy to access by public transport. There is a rope parc inside and a mini golf and such kind of stuff, you have to go through the garden until its very end.

I will never forget how much the park is loved by human and loved back in return.  "The light that plays, like a naked child, among the green leaves happily knows not that man can lie." by Rabindranath Tagore
Beautiful park which can be quite crowded. Toilets everywhere. Great for picnic!
